title.narrative: QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Quality and inclusive education services enhanced, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased number of girls and boys have access to and participate in better quality and inclusive education, including Roma children and boys and girls with disabilities

title.narrative: Quality and inclusive education services enhanced

description.narrative: UNICEF supported all Ministries of Education in BiH to ensure the continuity of learning during the school closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic. UNICEF provided technical assistance for improving e-learning and blended learning methodologies, while in coordination with education authorities UNICEF presented the guidelines, the latest research and evidence in preparation for the safe re-opening of schools after the summer. The findings from the 2019 Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS), published in 2020, confirmed that students in BiH are performing below the international average and that further action is needed for accelerated education sector reform. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
